contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=January 2009}} {{Chinese |t=張布 |s=张布 }} {{chinese name|[[Zhang (surname)|Zhang]]}} '''Zhang Bu''' (died 264) was a military general of [[Eastern Wu]] during the [[Three Kingdoms]] period of [[History of China|Chinese history]]. Zhang served as the Left General. Through the orders of the emperor [[Sun Xiu (emperor)|Sun Xiu]], Zhang, along with Right General [[Ding Feng (elder)|Ding Feng]], overthrew the regent [[Sun Chen]] in a coup. Zhang afterwards supported [[Sun Hao]]'s ascent to the throne of Eastern Wu, but ended up being killed for criticizing the brutality of Sun Hao. Zhang was one of many that were executed by the hands of Sun Hao simply because they did not agree with his tyranny. ==See also== *[[List of people of the Three Kingdoms]] {{People of Eastern Wu}} {{Persondata | NAME = Zhang, Bu | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Chinese general | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 264 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zhang, Bu}} [[Category:264 deaths]] [[Category:Eastern Wu generals]] [[Category:Eastern Wu politicians]] [[Category:Executed Eastern Wu people]] [[Category:People executed by Eastern Wu]] [[Category:3rd-century executions]] {{China-bio-stub}}
